did.head: Overview

did.unittitle: Institute for Research on Educational Finance and Governance (U.S.) Records

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is held in off-site storage and there will be a considerable delay in paging materials.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Institute for Research on Educational Finance and Governance (U.S.). Records, SC 587, Stanford University Archives, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Institute for Research on Educational Finance and Governance (IFG) was established in 1979 with a five-year committment from the National Institute of Education; it was administered through the School of Education at Stanford University. Its research program focused on educational finance and economics, educational politics, educational organizations, and law and education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These records consist of files on reports and papers published by IFG which include the text of the paper or report, with some correspondence, memoranda, press releases, and other materials. Authors represented by a number of publications include Michael W. Kirst, Henry M. Levin, Russell W. Rumberger, and Hans N. Weiler.

The published version of most of these papers is available in the Stanford University Libraries; researchers should consult those first. This collection is held in off-site storage and there will be a considerable delay in paging materials.
